title: Authors and Citation
text: Tom Elliott. Author, maintainer. Zhaoming Su. Author. Junjie Zeng. Contributor. Simon Potter. Contributor. David Banks. Contributor. Marco Kuper. Contributor. Dongning Zhang. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Elliott T, Su Z (2025). iNZightTS: Time Series 'iNZight'. R package version 2.0.1, https://inzight.nz.
code: @Manual{,   title = {iNZightTS: Time Series for 'iNZight'},   author = {Tom Elliott and Zhaoming Su},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 2.0.1},   url = {https://inzight.nz}, }

title: Time Series for iNZight
text: iNZightTS package provides simple analysis tools exploring time series data, used iNZight. package uses tidyverts store process time series data ggplot2 produce customisable graphics.

title: Time Series for iNZight
text: stable version can installed CRAN: Install GitHub:
code: install.packages("iNZightTS") remotes::install_github("iNZightVIT/iNZightTS")

title: Time Series for iNZight
code: library(iNZightTS)

title: Time Series for iNZight
text: Use inzightts function create temporal data set used functions package. data stored tsibble.
code: data <- visitorsQ |>     tidyr::pivot_longer(!Date, names_to = "Country", values_to = "Visitors") |>     inzightts(key = "Country") data #> # A tsibble: 216 x 3 [1Q] #> # Key:       Country [4] #>      index Country   Visitors #>      <qtr> <chr>        <int> #>  1 1998 Q4 Australia    20288 #>  2 1999 Q1 Australia    22047 #>  3 1999 Q2 Australia    14362 #>  4 1999 Q3 Australia    15775 #>  5 1999 Q4 Australia    21209 #>  6 2000 Q1 Australia    25261 #>  7 2000 Q2 Australia    15891 #>  8 2000 Q3 Australia    17117 #>  9 2000 Q4 Australia    22761 #> 10 2001 Q1 Australia    27539 #> # ℹ 206 more rows

title: Time Series for iNZight
text: Exploratory analysis time series data starts smoothed line plot.
code: plot(data)

title: Time Series for iNZight
text: Time series data often exhibit features trend, season cycle. decomposition plot breaks data visual components simplies analysis.
code: dcmp <- data |>     dplyr::filter(Country == "Australia") |>     inzightts() |>     decomp() dcmp #> # A dable: 54 x 8 [1Q] #> # Key:     Country, .model [1] #> # :        Visitors = trend + season_year + remainder #>    Country   .model                        index Visitors  trend season_year remainder season_adjust #>  * <chr>     <chr>                         <qtr>    <dbl>  <dbl>       <dbl>     <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 Australia feasts::STL(Visitors ~ tre… 1998 Q4    20288 16858.       2191.     1239.        18097. #>  2 Australia feasts::STL(Visitors ~ tre… 1999 Q1    22047 17586.       7515.    -3054.        14532. #>  3 Australia feasts::STL(Visitors ~ tre… 1999 Q2    14362 18173.      -5731.     1920.        20093. #>  4 Australia feasts::STL(Visitors ~ tre… 1999 Q3    15775 18928.      -3975.      822.        19750. #>  5 Australia feasts::STL(Visitors ~ tre… 1999 Q4    21209 19248.       2191.     -230.        19018. #>  6 Australia feasts::STL(Visitors ~ tre… 2000 Q1    25261 19601.       7515.    -1855.        17746. #>  7 Australia feasts::STL(Visitors ~ tre… 2000 Q2    15891 20127.      -5731.     1496.        21622. #>  8 Australia feasts::STL(Visitors ~ tre… 2000 Q3    17117 20652.      -3975.      439.        21092. #>  9 Australia feasts::STL(Visitors ~ tre… 2000 Q4    22761 20972.       2191.     -402.        20570. #> 10 Australia feasts::STL(Visitors ~ tre… 2001 Q1    27539 21528.       7515.    -1504.        20024. #> # ℹ 44 more rows plot(dcmp, title = "Visitors to Australia")

title: Time Series for iNZight
text: Plots helpful revealing underlying seasonal pattern time series data.
code: seasonplot(data) subseries(data)

what: Decompose a time series object — decomp
title: Decompose a time series object — decomp
text: Decomposes time series represented inz_ts object seasonal, trend, remainder components using specified smoothing method.

title: Decompose a time series object — decomp
code: decomp(   x,   var = NULL,   sm_model = c("stl"),   mult_fit = FALSE,   model_range = NULL,   ... )  # S3 method for class 'inz_dcmp' plot(   x,   recompose.progress = c(0, 0),   recompose = any(recompose.progress > 0),   ylab = NULL,   title = NULL,   colour = c("#1B9E46", "#45a8ff", "orangered"),   ... )

title: Decompose a time series object — decomp
text: x `inz_dcmp` object representing decomposed time series. var character vector length one, NULL. sm_model smoothing method used. Currently "stl" available. mult_fit TRUE, multiplicative model used; otherwise, additive model used default. model_range range data decomposed model. can specified dates years. part model_range lies outside range data, exceeding proportion ignored. ... Additional arguments (ignored). recompose.progress numeric vector length 2, controlling display recomposition progress `recompose` `TRUE`. first component shows progress seasonal component (0 1), second component tracks number observations recomposed far. recompose Logical indicating whether recomposition displayed . ylab label y-axis plot. title title plot. colour vector three colors specifying colors trend, seasonal, residuals components, respectively.

title: Decompose a time series object — decomp
text: inz_dcmp object, sub-class dable, representing decomposed components time series.

title: Decompose a time series object — decomp
text: R. B. Cleveland, W. S. Cleveland, J.E. McRae, . Terpenning (1990) STL: Seasonal-Trend Decomposition Procedure Based Loess. Journal Official Statistics, 6, 3iV73.

title: Decompose a time series object — decomp
code: ts <- inzightts(visitorsQ) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'tsibble': #>   method               from  #>   as_tibble.grouped_df dplyr d <- decomp(ts) #> Decomp variable not specified, automatically selected `var = "Australia"`  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ plot(d) } # }

title: Forecast future observations — predict.inz_ts
text: Generates future predictions time series inzightts object. output object includes predicted means, prediction intervals, raw data, fitted values.

title: Forecast future observations — predict.inz_ts
code: # S3 method for class 'inz_ts' predict(   object,   var = NULL,   h = 8,   mult_fit = FALSE,   pred_model = "auto",   confint_width = 0.95,   model_range = NULL,   ... )  # S3 method for class 'inz_frct' plot(x, t_range = NULL, xlab = NULL, ylab = NULL, title = NULL, ...)

title: Forecast future observations — predict.inz_ts
text: object inzightts object representing time series. var character vector specifying variable(s) forecast, set NULL forecast variables. h forecast horizon, either number observations predict, character string specifying time interval predict (e.g., "2 years"). mult_fit Logical; set TRUE multiplicative model, FALSE default additive model. pred_model name fable model function "auto". confint_width decimal representing width prediction interval. model_range range data used fitting forecasts, specified dates years. ... Additional arguments (ignored). x inz_frct object containing forecasts. t_range range data plotted, specified dates years. xlab title x-axis plot. ylab title y-axis plot. title title graph.

title: Forecast future observations — predict.inz_ts
text: inz_frct object containing forecasts.

title: Forecast future observations — predict.inz_ts
code: t <- inzightts(visitorsQ, var = c(2, 4)) ## The following two examples are equivalent pred <- predict(t, names(t)[-1], h = "2 years") pred <- predict(t, names(t)[-1], h = 8)  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ plot(pred) } # }

title: Summarise iNZightTS forecasts — summary.inz_frct
text: Summary method objects class inz_frct.

title: Summarise iNZightTS forecasts — summary.inz_frct
code: # S3 method for class 'inz_frct' summary(object, var = NULL, ...)  # S3 method for class 'summary_inz_frct' print(x, show_details = FALSE, ...)

title: Summarise iNZightTS forecasts — summary.inz_frct
text: object inz_frct object representing forecasts. var character vector specifying variable summarize, set NULL summarize variables. ... Additional arguments (ignored). x `summary_inz_frct` object containing forecast summaries. show_details Logical; set `TRUE` show model details `pred_model` "ARIMA" model.

title: Summarise iNZightTS forecasts — summary.inz_frct
text: summary_inz_frct object containing first forecast observations, forecasting model used, details (call, coefficients, goodness fit statistics).

what: Preliminary check for a plotly::ggplotly() call — ggplotable
title: Preliminary check for a plotly::ggplotly() call — ggplotable
text: Check plot generated iNZightTS can passed plotly::ggplotly().

title: Preliminary check for a plotly::ggplotly() call — ggplotable
code: ggplotable(x)

title: Preliminary check for a plotly::ggplotly() call — ggplotable
text: x ggplot object produced iNZightTS

title: Preliminary check for a plotly::ggplotly() call — ggplotable
text: logical

title: Preliminary check for a plotly::ggplotly() call — ggplotable
code: x <- inzightts(visitorsQ) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ggplotable(plot(x)) ggplotable(plot(x, names(x)[-1])) } # }

title: Time Series Data Analysis — iNZightTS-package
text: iNZightTS package provides simple analysis tools exploring time series data. used iNZight software.

title: Time Series Data Analysis — iNZightTS-package
text: Tom Elliott (previously: Marco Kuper, Simon Potter, David Banks)

what: Coerce data to an inzightts (time-series) object — inzightts
title: Coerce data to an inzightts (time-series) object — inzightts
text: function inzightts creates temporal data frames use iNZight. Unlike ts objects, tsibble objects enable temporal data wrangling, adapting tidy data principles, data- model-oriented.

title: Coerce data to an inzightts (time-series) object — inzightts
code: inzightts(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'character' inzightts(x, stringsAsFactors = TRUE, as.is = TRUE, ...)  # S3 method for class 'data.frame' inzightts(   x,   var = NULL,   index = NULL,   key = NULL,   start = NULL,   end = NULL,   freq = NULL,   ... )  # S3 method for class 'ts' inzightts(x, var_name = NULL, pivot_longer = FALSE, ...)  # S3 method for class 'tbl_ts' inzightts(x, ...)

title: Coerce data to an inzightts (time-series) object — inzightts
text: x data.frame, ts, tsibble, path. ... Additional arguments passed methods. stringsAsFactors See read.csv .See read.csv var column number name data representing observations used actual time series. index column number name data containing time variable. key variable(s) uniquely determine time indices. start time first observation. can single number vector two integers representing natural time unit (1-based) number samples time unit. end time last observation, specified way start. freq number observations per unit time. var_name new name variable column univariate time series, applicable x mts object. pivot_longer Logical; set TRUE transform data "longer" form, otherwise keep current form. Applicable x mts object.

title: Coerce data to an inzightts (time-series) object — inzightts
text: inzightts (inz_ts) object, sub-class tsibble, includes index variable, temporal variable, , applicable, relevant keys.

title: Coerce data to an inzightts (time-series) object — inzightts
text: ts object used create inzightts object, domain information extracted object. index parameter character, Date, yearweek, yearmonth, yearquarter object. index character, function recognizes following time variable formats without case sensitivity: "(Y)yyyy": annually data, e.g., "(Y)1991" "(Y)yyyyMmm": monthly data, e.g., "(Y)1991M01" "(Y)yyyyQqq": quarterly data, e.g., "(Y)1991Q01" "(Y)yyyyWww": weekly data yearly seasonality, e.g., "(Y)1991W01" "(Y)yyyyDdd": daily data yearly seasonality, e.g., "(Y)1991D01" "WwwDdd": daily data weekly seasonality, e.g., "W01D01" "DddHhh": hourly data daily seasonality, e.g., "D01H01" length digits time unit flexible, spaces time unit allowed. case data data.frame path .csv file, start omitted, starting date freq extracted column includes time information. column either named "Time" first column. end omitted, data used time-series.

title: Coerce data to an inzightts (time-series) object — inzightts
code: # create from a ts object z <- inzightts(UKgas) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ plot(z) } # }  # create from a data.frame x <- inzightts(     data.frame(Return = rnorm(100), Time = 1900:1999),     var = "Return" ) # or specify a time column x <- inzightts(     data.frame(Return = rnorm(100), Year = 1900:1999),     var = "Return", index = "Year" )  # create from a data.frame with modified time frame y <- inzightts(     data.frame(Return = rnorm(100)),     start = c(1990, 1), end = c(1993, 5), freq = 12, var = 1 ) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ plot(y) } # }

title: Apply logarithmic transformation — log_if
text: Log-transforms input x mult_fit TRUE; otherwise, returns original input x unchanged.

title: Apply logarithmic transformation — log_if
code: log_if(x, mult_fit)

title: Apply logarithmic transformation — log_if
text: x numeric vector transformed. mult_fit Logical; set TRUE apply logarithmic transformation, FALSE keep original input.

title: Apply logarithmic transformation — log_if
text: numeric vector applying logarithmic transformation (mult_fit = TRUE); otherwise, returns original input.

title: Apply logarithmic transformation — log_if
code: x <- runif(1e4, 1, 100) all.equal(log_if(x, TRUE), log(x)) #> [1] TRUE all.equal(log_if(x, FALSE), x) #> [1] TRUE

what: Draw a simple time series plot — plot.inz_ts
title: Draw a simple time series plot — plot.inz_ts
text: Draws plot given inzightts (inz_ts) object trend superimposed.

title: Draw a simple time series plot — plot.inz_ts
code: # S3 method for class 'inz_ts' plot(   x,   var = NULL,   xlab = NULL,   ylab = NULL,   title = NULL,   xlim = NULL,   aspect = NULL,   compare = TRUE,   pal = NULL,   smoother = TRUE,   sm_model = "stl",   t = 0,   mult_fit = FALSE,   emphasise = NULL,   non_emph_opacity = 0.2,   show_iso_obs = TRUE,   iso_obs_size = 1,   seasonal_adjustment = FALSE,   ... )

title: Draw a simple time series plot — plot.inz_ts
text: x inzightts (inz_ts) object representing time series. var character vector specifying variable(s) plotted, set NULL. xlab title x-axis plot. ylab title y-axis plot. title title graph. xlim Axis limits, specified dates years. aspect aspect ratio plot; aspect times wider high. compare Logical; set TRUE plot key levels single plot. pal (categorical variable passed var): colour palette categorical plot. palette vector order per rows tsibble::key_data(x). smoother Logical; TRUE, smoother drawn. sm_model smoothing method used. t smoothing parameter (0 100). mult_fit Logical; set TRUE multiplicative model, FALSE default additive model. emphasise Integer vector specify key level(s) focus plot. integer maps specific key level(s) corresponding ith row tsibble::key_data(x). non_emph_opacity Numeric. (0, 1], argument determines opacity series focused one(s) (highlight focused series). non_emph_opacity = 0, plot draws focused series scales. show_iso_obs Logical; set TRUE plot isolated observations time series gaps (). iso_obs_size Numeric; scaling size isolated observations, show_iso_obs = TRUE exist. seasonal_adjustment Logical; set TRUE show seasonally adjusted time series (.e., removed estimated seasonal effects determined STL decomoposition; see decomp()). ... Additional arguments (ignored).

title: Draw a simple time series plot — plot.inz_ts
text: time series plot (constructed ggplot2) returned, can added desired.

title: Draw a simple time series plot — plot.inz_ts
code: t <- inzightts(visitorsQ, var = c(2, 4))  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ plot(t) plot(t, var = names(t)[-1]) plot(t, var = "Japan") plot(t, mult_fit = TRUE) } # }

text: dataset containing sea ice measurements 1990 2011.

title: Sea Ice — seaice
code: seaice

title: Sea Ice — seaice
text: data frame 265 rows 3 variables: Time time variable Arctic Sea ice measurement Arctic Antarctica Sea ice measurement Antarctica

what: Plot seasonal subseries from a time series — seasonplot
title: Plot seasonal subseries from a time series — seasonplot
text: function plots seasonal components time series together estimated seasonal effects series.

title: Plot seasonal subseries from a time series — seasonplot
code: seasonplot(x, ...)

title: Plot seasonal subseries from a time series — seasonplot
text: x `inzightts` (`inz_ts`) object representing time series. ... arguments passed onto specific methods `gg_season` function.

title: Plot seasonal subseries from a time series — seasonplot
text: `patchwork` object seasonal plots.

title: Plot seasonal subseries from a time series — seasonplot
text: resulting window contain two plots. left, every seasonal subseries time series plotted. right average seasonal effect series.

title: Plot seasonal subseries from a time series — seasonplot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ seasonplot(inzightts(visitorsQ)) } # }

what: Seasonal Subseries Plots for inzightts — subseries
title: Seasonal Subseries Plots for inzightts — subseries
text: Time series subseries plot seasonal period

title: Seasonal Subseries Plots for inzightts — subseries
code: subseries(   x,   var = NULL,   show_mean = TRUE,   xlab = NULL,   ylab = NULL,   title = NULL )

title: Seasonal Subseries Plots for inzightts — subseries
text: x time series object represented inz_ts tbl_ts object. var character vector specifying variable(s) plotted, set NULL plot variables. show_mean Logical; set FALSE exclude mean line plot. xlab title x-axis plot. ylab title y-axis plot. title title graph.

title: Seasonal Subseries Plots for inzightts — subseries
text: ggplot object seasonal subseries plot.

title: Seasonal Subseries Plots for inzightts — subseries
text: Plots seasonal subseries time series represented inz_ts tbl_ts object. subseries represents one seasonal period.

title: Seasonal Subseries Plots for inzightts — subseries
code: t <- inzightts(visitorsQ) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ subseries(t) } # }

title: iNZightTS 2.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-01-17 new package based original iNZightTS package. Versioning continue, long-term plan merge changes original package fully deprecated. rebuild package features tidyverts new: sub-series plot enhanced: introduce key multiple time series enhanced: changed default behaviour multiple variables time series plots added readme example usage (#56) Previous versions original iNZightTS package listed .

title: iNZightTS 1.5.9
text: CRAN release: 2022-01-31 fix bug occurs data passed iNZightTS() tibble

title: iNZightTS 1.5.8
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-21 change arguments avoid deprecation arguments next ggplot2 release (#62)

title: iNZightTS 1.5.7
text: CRAN release: 2020-10-18 print comparison plots always shown graphics device

title: iNZightTS 1.5.6
text: add colour legend subtitle decomposition plot

title: iNZightTS 1.5.5
text: fix bug preventing basic plots working annual data

title: iNZightTS 1.5.4
text: fix bug meant passing recompose = TRUE plot method decomposition objects ignored

title: iNZightTS 1.5.3
text: fix small bug detecting time information [ subset operator returns tibble/dataframe (vector)

title: iNZightTS 1.5.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-05-12 disable multiplicative series values zero lower add appropriate subtitle trend panel decomposition plot fix bug preventing iNZightTS accepting valid stats::ts object specify stringsAsFactors = TRUE upcoming R 4.0.0 fix documentation CRAN

title: iNZightTS 1.5.1
text: Release date: 14 November 2019 fix bug seasonplot() strange interaction Windows’ Cairo() graphics device egg::ggarrange() resulting graphs displayed

title: iNZightTS 1.5
text: Release date: 11 November 2019 add argument plot() functions show smoother (default TRUE) add UTF-8 encoding DESCRIPTION file requested roxygen :) add ggplot2 version season plot decompose plot compare plot additive effects, make main effects y-limits equally scaled fix bug smoothing parameter wasn’t passed compare effects graph

title: iNZightTS 1.4.3
text: Release date: 2 September 2019 automatically detect 5-day week data (opposed 7-day week)

title: iNZightTS 1.4.2
text: Release date: 15 July 2019 specify (time/horizontal) axes limits view part time series (#16) use part series create model + forecast (#17) recode forecast plot using ggplot2

title: iNZightTS 1.4.1
text: Release date: 29 May 2018 add seasonal lines cycle back separate-series comparison plot

title: iNZightTS 1.4
text: Release date: 23 January 2018 ggplot2 now used (majority ) time series graphs various bugfixes

title: iNZightTS 1.3-1
text: Release date: 20 October 2017 Modify missing-values error message

title: iNZightTS 1.3
text: Release date: 02 October 2017 Bug fixes package improvements pass CRAN checks

title: iNZightTS 1.2
text: Release date: 24 March 2017 Main change addition smoothing parameter plots Improved time variable detection, including weekly, daily, hourly data Better use x- y-axis labels minor bug fixes

title: iNZightTS 1.1.7
text: Release date: 23 September 2016 catch errors trying guess TS structure

title: iNZightTS 1.1.6
text: Release date: 02 February 2015 reposition axis label

title: iNZightTS 1.1.5
text: Release date: 12 January 2015 fixed missed function export compareplot

title: iNZightTS 1.1.3
text: Release date: 17 September 2014 added x label additional plots

title: iNZightTS 1.1.2
text: Release date: 4 April 2014 y-axis label support now plots. Various bug fixes accommodate multiplicative time series.

title: iNZightTS 1.1.1
text: Release date: 27 March 2014 New functionality using proportion values calculate x, calculated using order control x-axis. Changed graphical parameter settings avoid -writing objects “white” background.

title: iNZightTS 1.1
text: Release date: 18 January 2014 user-visible changes package, however re-released launch iNZight 2.0.
